title: gwolf666
author: gwolf666
content: Don't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?Congratulations! you are the user number 50,000 who starts the same topic.I understand you are new in the forum, but before starting a topic it is worth using the search tool to see if someone else has already talked about it, and who is satoshi? is a question that most users have talked about in the forum's history.The answer is simple:No one knows who Satoshi is.No one knows if Satoshi is a user or a group of users.No one knows if Satoshi is still alive.

comments.author: gwolf666
comments.body: Yes I imagined it but is there no new information regarding this? Satoshi had a profile here, right? Did he create this forum or was it already created when Satoshi registered? Because if he is not the owner, maybe the owner of this forum can track the IP or I don't know, but isn't there some type of current information on who could be the person most likely to be satoshi? I rule out the possibility that he is dead, for me he is more alive than ever.

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? We are not the one to dictate when is the right time for him to reveal himself. He might never reveal himself. There’s really no reason for him to anyway. Bitcoin is working just as fine and people who try to take his identity fail anyway since they do not have enough evidence to prove that they are indeed Satoshi.If he reveals himself, he will just be putting himself in danger. Government agencies will now have someone to attack since they can’t take down the entire bitcoin network. It’s wise, imo, to just disappear.

comments.author: gwolf666
comments.body: Quote from: Reatim on September 21, 2024, 03:14:38 AMQuote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? We are not the one to dictate when is the right time for him to reveal himself. He might never reveal himself. There’s really no reason for him to anyway. Bitcoin is working just as fine and people who try to take his identity fail anyway since they do not have enough evidence to prove that they are indeed Satoshi.If he reveals himself, he will just be putting himself in danger. Government agencies will now have someone to attack since they can’t take down the entire bitcoin network. It’s wise, imo, to just disappear. That is a good point, but perhaps an agreement could be reached with governments, with how normalized cryptocurrency is today and taking into account that countries like El Salvador officially accept it, I believe that despite having some enemies He would have a few allies, but if not, at least he reappears anonymously clarifying who he is NOT, as if to take credit away from the impostors who try to make believe that he is satoshi haha ​​I deduce that at this point if he is still alive he must be swimming in a sea of money and living a great life and if not, I should

comments.author: SilverCryptoBullet
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?No one knew who is/are Satoshi Nakamoto and assume there are people knew about Satoshi Nakamoto's identity, they have yet shared that information publicly.I gathered every Satoshi Nakamoto thread.Some people thought Hal Finney, who is a first person received an on chain transaction from Satoshi Nakamoto, is Satoshi Nakamoto. It's a conspiracy theory that is believed by many people while some others like Jameson Lopp debunked it.Why Hal Finney is not Satoshi NakamotoFor people who claimed that they are Satoshi Nakamoto, like Craig Wright. They're Faketoshi.

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed?Nah. There's no way charges wouldn't be concocted against them & they get arrested -- even extradited to the US from whatever other country they may currently be in. It would be a total catastrophe. Best case scenario: Satoshi is a team of people from the NSA, or else deceased (RIP if true).

comments.author: mamesso
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?Questions like this have been speculated about since bitcoin first appeared. Satoshi Nakamoto will most likely never appear or reveal his identity to the public because many parties are hunting him, including the government trying to prosecute him on charges of trying to damage the financial system (Central Bank) and government regulations. Satoshi's genius is unmatched, he had already predicted what would happen in the future after the protocol became more widespread, he could never live a quality life again if his identity was revealed, moreover he also held more than 1 million bitcoins which made him among the richest people in the world. That's why Satoshi will never give up his anonymity, and that's how it should be.

comments.author: FinneysTrueVision
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 03:03:40 AMYes I imagined it but is there no new information regarding this? Satoshi had a profile here, right? Did he create this forum or was it already created when Satoshi registered? Because if he is not the owner, maybe the owner of this forum can track the IP or I don't know, but isn't there some type of current information on who could be the person most likely to be satoshi? I rule out the possibility that he is dead, for me he is more alive than ever.Satoshi did create the forum. Even if the current administrators had any information that could expose his identity it would be unethical for them to reveal it without his consent. It would destroy their credibility and who knows what kind of consequences this would have, for Satoshi personally, and for the Bitcoin ecosystem as a whole.Anyone’s opinion on whether he is alive is irrelevant. It doesn’t entitle you to know anything which isn’t already public knowledge.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: Don't you think about the future of bitcoin? Have you ever thought about what would happen to bitcoin if Satoshi made his identity public and came out? Satoshi gave up glory, fame and decided to go completely anonymous because he wanted bitcoin to be in the best possible shape. So we should thank and respect his decision instead of constantly looking for him when that is what he hates the most.To me, satoshi is satoshi, the guy who created bitcoin, I don't want to know anything more about him, that's it.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?It is unnecessary and at work credit are those who claims to be Satoshi Nakamoto being rewarded?In an insight, even any of those are still keeping anonymous so, if in anyway his unrevealing of himself is causing chaos to the Bitcoin community community were some persons claims to be him, then let them show off with proves.However, recalling that Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency, it is every individual right to decide on revealing their IDs and holdings to the public but he sure you are risking your assets because thefts would only have you on target if they knows your worth. This is the uniqueness of Bitcoin to the fiats.

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Your wish is way past due OP and in my opinion, people don't really care anymore about the identity behind the enigma that is Satoshi Nakomoto, I think people already knew to respect the privacy behind the identity and I think that you OP should be a part of that crowd too, it's never going to be good if you obsess over something that you don't have a control anyway.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Quote from: mamesso on September 21, 2024, 06:26:04 AMQuote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?Questions like this have been speculated about since bitcoin first appeared. Satoshi Nakamoto will most likely never appear or reveal his identity to the public because many parties are hunting him, including the government trying to prosecute him on charges of trying to damage the financial system (Central Bank) and government regulations. Satoshi's genius is unmatched, he had already predicted what would happen in the future after the protocol became more widespread, he could never live a quality life again if his identity was revealed, moreover he also held more than 1 million bitcoins which made him among the richest people in the world. That's why Satoshi will never give up his anonymity, and that's how it should be. Nah they would never, why would their Glorious self do such. They are going to charge him for running a criminal den without supervision. A typical story or they would brand him a terrorist or supporter fueling their agenda. They would never state anything that would make it appear they are weak. Face matters alot. Not all mystery end up been solved like Jack the ripper though they are different view/speculation but personally not really interested on Who or what Satoshi is.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 03:03:40 AMYes I imagined it but is there no new information regarding this? Not that ma sure of except for what we already know. And if there was any new information It won't take a sec for the anti-bitcoinists to blow the whistle.QuoteSatoshi had a profile here, right? Did he create this forum or was it already created when Satoshi registered? Because if he is not the owner, maybe the owner of this forum can track the IP or I don't know, but isn't there some type of current information on who could be the person most likely to be satoshi? I rule out the possibility that he is dead, for me he is more alive than ever.what does it matter to you knowing about him/them? Why not rather divert this energy on getting informations that can build your knowledge on how you can use bitcoin to establish for yourself some financial stability, security, freedom and privacy. We all know who is Jeff Bezos, Mark Zuckerberg etc, but that doesn't change our financial status just by knowing about them it's rather how we make use of their invention to our advantage that creates wealth for us. So in essence focus on making use of bitcoin that's at your disposal and worry less about who Satoshi is cause that won't top a cent in your piggy bank.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: The better question is "What is Satoshi Nakamoto"But like they said, some mysteries are better left unsolved. It is in my opinion futile to chase after a shadow or concept like that. Savor what they have gifted us and use it like their ideal had mentioned. It is better not to consider any specific person or team as satoshi, because it will provide a false idol.If you are using bitcoin, you are satoshi in all sense.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?Nope, it's not the right time to reveal who's Satoshi Nakamoto, and if you ask me then I would say that even in future it's not going to be fruitful to know who's Satoshi Nakamoto, or who he was. What we all know is that Satoshi Nakamoto has created Bitcoin that has helped millions of investors and traders, and we see crypto market and exchange's only because of Satoshi Nakamoto.The ones who might know who Satoshi was will still remain quiet or who knows that other than Satoshi know one knows who's the person behind Bitcoin's creation.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: You’re not the first person to ask this question neither are you the hundredth, and certainly you won’t be the last. Instead of trying to uncover the identity of Satoshi, why don’t you focus on the tech he created. Why don’t you look at Bitcoin and think of ways you can use bitcoin to make your own life easier. You will find a compilation of every Satoshi thread here: I gathered every Satoshi Nakamoto thread

comments.author: Ziskinberg
comments.body: Quote from: gwolf666 on September 21, 2024, 01:35:05 AMDon't you think it's time for the mystery to be revealed? There are some people who are trying to take over the name of the creator of Bitcoin. Don't you think it's time for him to reveal who he is? Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? Can any user who has been here from the beginning give us information about this?It’s better to keep him anonymous, safer for him and it avoids causing a stir in the crypto world.Based on what I’ve read, Satoshi reportedly has almost 1 million BTC. If that's true, it would be worth around $63 billion now, putting him in the top 10 richest people in the world. If you had that much money, it’s probably best to stay quiet and enjoy life without the fear of being robbed, or even worse, killed.

comments.author: mamesso
comments.body: Quote from: Ambatman on September 21, 2024, 09:29:27 AMNah they would never, why would their Glorious self do such. They are going to charge him for running a criminal den without supervision. A typical story or they would brand him a terrorist or supporter fueling their agenda.Anonymous would be better for Satoshi because he owns more bitcoins than anyone else in the world. Revealing his identity will create a threat to his life and may be the end of his life as he has bitcoins worth billions of dollars, this will attract the attention of criminals and the government will also trouble him and may continue to make his life difficult with various accusations. Quote from: Ambatman on September 21, 2024, 09:29:27 AMThey would never state anything that would make it appear they are weak. Face matters alot. Not all mystery end up been solved like Jack the ripper though they are different view/speculation but personally not really interested on Who or what Satoshi is. He has prepared everything carefully. If Bitcoin wants to succeed with a decentralized concept, it must grow naturally, without a leading figure because anything that comes out of the leader will be misunderstood or interpreted as investment advice that causes price movements. A similar scenario happened to Dogecoin when Elon Musk tweeted on his personal X account (even though he is not the creator of Dogecoin). Let Satoshi remain a mystery, everyone should respect his privacy. What is more important is what he left for all of us.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: SatoPrincess on September 21, 2024, 10:42:30 AMYou will find a compilation of every Satoshi thread here: I gathered every Satoshi Nakamoto threadPerhaps it's time to add this new one too LOL@gwolf666 Satoshi Nakamoto is a ghost, if you dig deeper then he will become your nightmare.
